connector.description: Send messages to an AWS Simple Notification Topic using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSNSClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSNSClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSNSClient.description: To use the AmazonSNS as the client

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateTopic.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateTopic
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateTopic.description: Setting the autocreation of the topic

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to map headers to/from Camel.

camel.sink.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId
camel.sink.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SNS or a custom CMK.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplication.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplicationIdStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplication.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message. One of: [useExchangeId] [useContentBasedDeduplication]

camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrate.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used. One of: [useConstant] [useExchangeId] [usePropertyValue]

camel.sink.endpoint.messageStructure.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageStructure
camel.sink.endpoint.messageStructure.description: The message structure to use such as json

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SNS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SNS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SNS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which SNS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryptionEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the topic

camel.sink.endpoint.subject.name: camel.sink.endpoint.subject
camel.sink.endpoint.subject.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSnsSubject' is not present.

camel.sink.endpoint.subscribeSNStoSQS.name: camel.sink.endpoint.subscribeSNStoSQS
camel.sink.endpoint.subscribeSNStoSQS.description: Define if the subscription between SNS Topic and SQS must be done or not

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.aws2-sns.amazonSNSClient.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.amazonSNSClient
camel.component.aws2-sns.amazonSNSClient.description: To use the AmazonSNS as the client

camel.component.aws2-sns.autoCreateTopic.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.autoCreateTopic
camel.component.aws2-sns.autoCreateTopic.description: Setting the autocreation of the topic

camel.component.aws2-sns.messageDeduplic.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. One of: [useExchangeId] [useContentBasedDeduplication]

camel.component.aws2-sns.messageGroupIdS.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.messageGroupIdStrategy
camel.component.aws2-sns.messageGroupIdS.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used. One of: [useConstant] [useExchangeId] [usePropertyValue]

camel.component.aws2-sns.messageStructur.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.messageStructure
camel.component.aws2-sns.messageStructur.description: The message structure to use such as json

camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SNS client

camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SNS client

camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-sns.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SNS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-sns.region.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.region
camel.component.aws2-sns.region.description: The region in which SNS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-sns.serverSideEncry.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.serverSideEncryptionEnabled
camel.component.aws2-sns.serverSideEncry.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the topic

camel.component.aws2-sns.subject.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.subject
camel.component.aws2-sns.subject.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSnsSubject' is not present.

camel.component.aws2-sns.subscribeSNStoS.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.subscribeSNStoSQS
camel.component.aws2-sns.subscribeSNStoS.description: Define if the subscription between SNS Topic and SQS must be done or not

camel.component.aws2-sns.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-sns.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-sns.useDefaultCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-sns.useDefaultCrede.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-sns.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-sns.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
